name: TheAtlantic
text: The grim effects of Trump’s wayward whims have turned Americans into a nation of armchair psychologists, struggling to understand the workings of one particular psyche, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/AkDS0gzqvl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Twitter—and companies like it—are essential to our national dialogue, to our economy, and to our democracy. We need to start treating them that way, and that means requiring them to do a better job on security and breaking them up," @schneierblog writes: https://t.co/FiDHHLYLK8

name: TheAtlantic
text: “We now have the technology to make periods optional.” Menstruation is becoming an elective bodily process, writes @MarionRenault: https://t.co/L3GTXBGe8J

name: TheAtlantic
text: In 2018, John Lewis shared with Vann R. Newkirk II how Martin Luther King Jr. recruited him into the civil-rights movement and what it was like to know the iconic activist. https://t.co/lg05KLTcGK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @olgakhazan explain how nursing homes came to account for over 40% of U.S. coronavirus deaths: https://t.co/He2Dur4n9c

name: TheAtlantic
text: NASA is typically associated with feats of space exploration, writes @PhilipHilts, but the agency has also played a key role in shaping the study of life on Earth. https://t.co/e6o7TgPDZ7

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two of our writers discuss the fallout so far—and detail the scary consequences still to come. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/C6NStWrmrW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I'm going to be the kind of congressperson where I’m going to be at rallies with the people, fighting for justice and being present," Jamaal Bowman, whom the Associated Press has said defeated incumbent Democrat Eliot Engel, told @IsaacDovere: https://t.co/mMXQr97T9u

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Solving an economic crisis like the one the U.S. faces requires both a clear-eyed diagnosis of the problem and a commitment to cushioning the blow for communities, small businesses, and workers," @jleibenluft writes: https://t.co/tSMri5vlSX
